body_html:
It's not hard to do a workaround. Just patch your state dict before loading.

We don't change such things be cause we "feel that dots should not be allowed in module names any more". There is a valid reason.

The change is orthogonal to the BC thing, and it is necessary.

Consider a submodule named norm containing weight named 1.weight and another named norm.1 containing weight named weight. They will overwrite each other in state_dict & load_state_dict without a warning/error.

body:
It's not hard to do a workaround. Just patch your state dict before loading.

We don't change such things be cause we "feel that dots should not be allowed in module names any more". There is a valid reason. 

The change is orthogonal to the BC thing, and it is necessary. 

Consider a submodule named `norm` containing weight named `1.weight` and another named `norm.1` containing weight named `weight`. They will overwrite each other in `state_dict` & `load_state_dict` without a warning/error.
